Agent A is correct that the use of strlen(realm) in calculate_add_nonce_with_retry can lead to a 21.17 violation unless there is an external, provable guarantee that realm points to a valid, NUL-terminated object. MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 forbids uses of the <string.h> functions that may read beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters; strlen is explicitly listed. In the shown function there is no NULL or bounds/NUL-termination check of the realm parameter before calling strlen(realm). Therefore, if a caller can pass NULL or a non-NUL-terminated buffer, strlen could read out of bounds and the code would be non-compliant with 21.17.

Note: If the API for this function (or higher-level invariants of the program) provably guarantees that realm is non-NULL and NUL-terminated on every call (e.g. by documented precondition or by checks performed by the caller or earlier in the call chain), then the call would not constitute a violation. In the absence of such a guarantee visible in the provided code, the report of a 21.17 violation is correct.
